attributes.action: attempt to resist the development of a 'tiered internet' system for the UK, wherever possible
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
ISPs are beginning to suggest the possibility of a 'tiered internet', whereby traffic to particular sites is prioritised over that of websites paying less.

However, this conflicts with the idea of a 'neutral network' and would mean smaller websites would be unable to gather the funds to be able to get significant bandwidth.

This would mean they would be unable to compete in numbers of visitors, therefore causing an effect similar to a monopoly, ruining the heritage of the internet as a free forum for exchange of ideas and products.
